Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Wildly \Wild"ly\, adv. In a wild manner; without cultivation; with disorder; rudely; distractedly; extravagantly. [1913 Webster]

wildly adv 1: to an extreme or greatly exaggerated degree; "the storyline is wildly unrealistic" 2: in an uncontrolled or unrestrained manner; "He gesticulated wildly" 3: with violent and uncontrollable passion; "attacked wildly, slashing and stabbing over and over"
